Metformin.eGFR_geq_45: 500 mg daily week 1, then 1000 mg daily; max 2000 mg daily (titrate per protocol)

GLP1.default: 0.25 mg weekly x4 weeks, then titrate to 0.5–1 mg weekly (max 2 mg weekly)

Semaglutide.default: 0.25 mg weekly x4 weeks; then 0.5, 1, or 2 mg weekly (titrate every 4 weeks)

Dulaglutide.default: 0.75 mg weekly x4 weeks; then 1.5, 3, or 4.5 mg weekly (titrate every 4 weeks)

Tirzepatide.default: 2.5 mg weekly x4 weeks; then 5–15 mg weekly (titrate every 4 weeks)

Exenatide.default: 5 mcg BID x4 weeks; then 10 mcg BID (titrate every 4 weeks)

Liraglutide.default: 0.6 mg daily x1 week; then 1.2 or 1.8 mg daily (titrate weekly)

Semaglutide Oral.default: 3 mg daily without food, 8 oz water; after 30 days 7 mg daily; then 14 mg after 30 days on 7 mg

Sulfonylurea.default: 2.5 mg daily; titrate to 5–20 mg daily (BID if >5 mg)

Glipizide.default: 2.5 mg daily; titrate to 2.5–20 mg daily (BID if >5 mg)

Glimepiride.default: 1 mg daily; titrate 1→2→4→8 mg (8 mg as 4 mg BID)

Glyburide.default: 1.25 mg daily; titrate to 2.5–20 mg daily (BID if >5 mg)

TZD.default: 15 mg daily; titrate to 30–45 mg every 4–12 weeks (effect at 4–6 weeks)

Basal Insulin.default: 10 units once daily at bedtime. If fasting blood sugar >150 mg/dL for 3 straight days, increase by 2 units. Max increase 10 units/day.
Basal Insulin.dose_adjustment_rules: TDD <20 units: 10 mg/dL lowering = 1 unit, 11–20 = 2, 21–30 = 3, 31–40 = 4, 41+ = 5. TDD 21–40: ≤30 mg/dL to goal = +10%, 31–60 = +15%, 61+ = +20%. TDD 41+: same % but cap +10 units total. If TDD >50 units consider adding GLP-1 or bolus. Unexplained fasting lows: reduce dose by 20%.

Bolus Insulin.default: 4 units 15–20 min before largest meal. If 2-h postprandial >200 mg/dL for 3 days, add 1 unit (up to 8). Max increase 10 units/day.
Bolus Insulin.dose_adjustment_rules: If 8 units at main meal insufficient: 1 meal/day = 10 units; 2 meals = 5 units each. If 10 units insufficient: 1 meal = 12 units; 2 meals = 6 each; 3 meals = 4 each. If 12–20 units insufficient: add 1–2 units per meal. TDD ≥21: ≤20 mg/dL to goal = +10% total divided by meals (cap +10); 21+ mg/dL = +15%. Unexplained postprandial lows: reduce total by 20%.

description: Goal 2: Dosing (eGFR-adjusted starting dose + dose increase when on therapy). Dose escalation logic remains in Lambda.
_comment_drug_level: To add drug-level starting doses: under starting_dose_by_class.<class> add 'by_drug' with keys = drug name (e.g. 'Saxagliptin'). Each drug entry can have 'medication' (display name), eGFR_* keys (eGFR_gt_60, eGFR_30_60, eGFR_lt_30, eGFR_gt_45, eGFR_lte_45, eGFR_geq_20, eGFR_geq_25, etc.), and 'default'. Pass preferredDrugByClass in the request (e.g. {"DPP4": "Saxagliptin"}) to use that drug's starting dose.
